page.title: 05CUSTOMS-LOCAL STORIES
page.content: Most of the local stories concern Loe pool and Loe bar. It is said that Sir Bedivere cast King Arthurs sword Excalibur into Loe pool. Loe Bar was supposed to have been formed by the Cornish giant Jan Tregeagle.While collecting shingle in his leather apron some slipped out and fell into the mouth of the River Cober. Every seven years Loe Pool is said to claim a life. About thirty years ago two planes collided over Loe Pool.One landed in the marshes,the other sank in Loe Pool and was never recovered because the pool is so deep. In 1841 a large Frog fish was found in the pool.It had been thrown in by the sea, probably during a storm.Inside its stomach were 18 trout and 2 eels.
